result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassandra L Kishner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Alter Price (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Walmart to be paid as a condition of probation, before costs and fees.

AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Comply with random urine screens.  No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia.   No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescription drug must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

timeConds.notes: Stayed.  To be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

miscConds.notes: Standard court costs waived. DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cassandra L Kishner

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant to have no contact with Walmart/Joseph Mack listed in the Criminal Complaint.

09:57 AM Defendant Cassandra L Kishner in court with attorney Brandon Carlson.   Attorney appears as friend of the court. Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court swears in the Defendant.  The Court extends the appointment of Attorney Sonderhouse. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
